summary: The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office's Patent Trial and Appeal Board was formed in 2012 as an alternative to federal courts for patent disputes. There is the potential for political-appointee office directors to influence judicial decisions. We testified about our ongoing review of the board and the independence of its judges. Among other things, we found: 75% of board judges who answered our survey said...
title: Patent Trial and Appeal Board: Preliminary Observations on Oversight of Judicial Decision-Making
